content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, secant x, plus, cosecant x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>csc</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions is the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, pi over 4 comma 3 pi over 8, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of open parenthesis, 3 pi over 8, close parenthesis, plus f of open parenthesis, pi over 4, close parenthesis, and denominator 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of open parenthesis, 3 pi over 8, close parenthesis, plus f of open parenthesis, pi over 4, close parenthesis, and denominator, the fraction 3 pi over 8, end fraction, plus pi over 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of open parenthesis, 3 pi over 8, close parenthesis, plus f of open parenthesis, pi over 4, close parenthesis, and denominator, the fraction 3 pi over 8, end fraction, plus pi over 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of open parenthesis, 3 pi over 8, close parenthesis, plus f of open parenthesis, pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of open parenthesis, 3 pi over 8, close parenthesis, plus f of open parenthesis, pi over 4, close parenthesis, and denominator, the fraction 3 pi over 8, end fraction, plus pi over 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
